In Gaza, 'journalists are dying, and everyone wonders if the next will be one of the two working for us'
description: Newsrooms around the world have expressed concern for their Palestinian colleagues in Gaza. Approximately 180 media outlets in 50 countries were expected to relay, on Monday, a call from Reporters Without Borders (RSF) and the Avaaz movement calling for an end to 'the killings in Gaza.'

Nestlé sacks CEO over 'undisclosed romantic' office relationship
description: Laurent Freixe was immediately dismissed on Monday. The board said it had ordered an investigation into Freixe, who had been with Nestlé since 1986, with the support of outside counsel. Meanwhile, Nespresso CEO Philipp Navratil was appointed by his fellow board members to take over the position.

headline: Skulls repatriated from France inflame heritage battle in Madagascar
description: The return of three Sakalava skulls to Madagascar, including one believed to be that of King Toera, beheaded by French colonial troops in 1897, has reignited a fierce conflict among his descendants.

headline: Posting the journey: How social media became a diary for gender transition
description: On Instagram, TikTok and X, many people document the ups and downs of their gender transitions to inform those just starting their journey and foster group solidarity.

headline: Political science researcher Antoine Bristielle: Block Everything is 'a movement structured almost exclusively around radical left sympathizers'
description: Bristielle conducted a study in the online groups of the Block Everything movement on September 10. He found that only 27% of respondents claimed to have been part of the Yellow Vest movement in 2019, he explained in an interview with Le Monde.

Ouahiba Bouzyane's first days in France after arriving from Morocco: 'I never dreamed of leaving my country. Things just turned out that way'
description: Ouahiba Bouzyane, 52, arrived from Morocco in 2002 after marrying a French man. Following a divorce and a new relationship, she is now a single mother of five in Paris.

headline: Malian refugee women recount repeated rapes by Russian mercenaries
description: Since 2021, several United Nations and International Federation for Human Rights reports have observed a rise in conflict-related sexual violence acts committed by Malian security forces and their Russian allies.

headline: Video: Why are young African women manufacturing Russian drones?
description: The Alabuga Special Economic Zone, in Tatarstan, Russia, has been producing drones since the start of the war in Ukraine. There, young African women have found themselves working on production lines, lured by a misleading vocational training program.
byline: Marceau Bretonnier,  Sinead McCausland and  Thomas Eydoux
